examples: I have engaged a secretary to deal with all my paperwork.
We're engaging the services of a professional administrator.

body_content.explanation: to interest someone in something and keep them thinking about it:
examples: The debate about food safety has engaged the whole nation.
If a book doesn't engage my interest in the first few pages, I don't usually continue reading it.

body_content.explanation: to become involved, or have contact, with someone or something:
examples: She's an intelligent child but in class she doesn't really engage.
Just stay out of his way as much as possible, and don't engage with him.

body_content.explanation: to make one part of a machine fit into and move together with another part of a machine:
examples: When the large gear wheel engages (with the smaller one), the mill stone will start to go round.

body_content.explanation: to attack or begin to fight someone:
examples: Enemy planes engaged the troops as they advanced into the mountains.

body_content.explanation: to teach someone, especially a class of children, or to keep someone busy
especially of a writer, musician, artist, etc. interested in and taking part in politics
